oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Standard molar Gibbs free energy of formation of PbO(s) over a wide temperature range from EMF measurements
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GANESAN, R
GNANASEKARAN, T
SRINIVASA, RS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: solid oxide electrolyte
liquid lead
oxygen
solubility
system
thermodynamics
cell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The EMF of the following galvanic cells, Kanthal, Re, Pb, PbO \CSZ\ O-2 (1 atm.), Pt Kanthal, Re, Pb, PbO \ CSZ \ O-2 (1 atm.), RuO2, Pt were measured as a function of temperature. With O-2 (1 atm.), RuO2 as the reference electrode, measurements were possible at low temperatures close to the melting point of Pb. Standard Gibbs energy of formation, DeltarG(m)(0)<beta-PbO> was calculated from the emf measurements made over a wide range of temperature (612-1111 K) and is given by the expression: Delta(f)G(m)(0) <beta-PbO> +/- 0.10 kJ = -218.98 + 0.09963T. A third law treatment of the data yielded a value of -218.08 +/- 0.07 kJ mol(-1) for the enthalpy of formation of PbO(s) at 298.15 K, Delta(f)H(m)(0)<beta-PbO> which is in excellent agreement with second law estimate of -218.07 +/- 0.07 kJ mol(-1). (C) 2003
